p: Some of the cardiovascular benefits evidenced in vitro and now in vivo through risk factors, such as blood lipids, and BP, could be related to the presence of omega-6 fats as linoleic acid, which is the major fatty acid of the seed oil. Nonetheless, the cardiovascular health benefits of linoleic acid are controversial ( Hooper et al., 2018; Marklund et al., 2019), and the positive effects of minor phytochemicals remains unclear.
